content:
31. The hybrids see themselves as superior to everything else ( there are no aliens in my novels ).
They do however have a bit of a conflicting feeling toward Mr. Gray who they know had created them out of his own DNA. So they feel a bit jealous and a bit inferior in some way. It's something that bothers them. The Hybrids sometimes feel an emptiness, they feel they're the pinnacle of evolution, so they have a desire to see something "better", but they also want to be forever in absolute power. The hybrids also aren't very creative, so they often feel bored.

32. The Hybrids use everything at their disposal, though they often delegate this to "Eunuchs", or other loyal servants. 

33. The Hybrids want absolute power and control, and to live in luxury and spoil themselves rotten. They really don't have any higher-minded ideals, which also makes them feel a bit insecure. They want to seem like they have this grand purpose, so they invent grand projects to do. They want to prove themselves to each other and to the ones below, but they're also too lazy to do too much, or to introspect too much. Leaving a lot to Raziel and the "Eunuch" class is what eventually leads to the danger of robbing the human species of sentience.

36. the interpretations vary wildly, because there was no one reliable source to explain the events back when they happened.

37. The hybrids have a panic from the thought of their own demise, so they try their best to avoid thinking about it. They want to see themselves as above death and mortality, and morality.

38. There are several
